postgres.notes: Level can be gold/silver/bronze. Remove the section if it doesn't support the database.

mysql.notes: Level can be gold/silver/bronze. Remove the section if it doesn't support the database.

sqlite.notes: Level can be gold/silver/bronze. Remove the section if it doesn't support the database.

other.notes: Level can be gold/silver/bronze. Remove the section if it doesn't support alternative databases. Bronze is one or two, silver is three or four, gold is five or more.

Query Builder.notes: This is the section for query builder functionality. Remove if the library doesn't support it.

Generic Mapper.notes: This is the section for generic mapper functionality, if you can't provide a random struct to map a result into, it's not a generic mapper. This doesn't have to include generics in the mapper.

ORM.notes: This is the section for ORM functionality. Remove if the library doesn't support it.

Query Mapper.notes: This is for generating a mapper based on a pre-written query. Remove if the library doesn't support it.

activity.notes: How often is the library updated? When was the last commit?

documentation.notes: Do they have a dedicated documentation site? Are there plenty of examples?

examples.notes: Does the library have like 5 examples or 35 examples?
